org.sd.util
Class Escaper

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.util.Escaper

public class Escaper
extends java.lang.Object

A utility class to store, apply, and unapply escape mappings to Strings.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Constructor Summary
Escaper(java.lang.String[][] mappings, int normalSetIndex)

Constructor Detail

Escaper

public Escaper(java.lang.String[][] mappings,
               int normalSetIndex)
Construct with the mappings (in order) to apply.

NOTE: The first mappings up to normalSetIndex are mappings form escape symbols themselves that cannot be applied in an overlapping fashion. The remainder of the mappings will be applied in an overlapping way.

Parameters:
mappings - Strings such that mappings[i][0] is the string whose escaped mapping is mappings[i][1].
normalSetIndex - The index in the mappings at which the normal set of overlappable mappings begins (as opposed to the escaping of escape symbols that need to be applied first without overlap.
Method Detail

escape

public java.lang.String escape(java.lang.String string)
Apply the escape mappings (forward).

unescape

public java.lang.String unescape(java.lang.String string)
Unapply the escape mappings (backward).
